author: wsjcom
title: Five Best: Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
text:
Mormon Midwife By Patty Bartlett Sessions (1997)
1. Patty Sessions was as adept at calling down the blessings of heaven as transforming old clothes into carpets. From 1847 to 1888, in terse day-by-day entries, she documented pioneer life in Utah. She believed in “plural marriage” as a divine principle. Living it was more difficult. Her husband’s first plural wife left him and Mormonism after wrangling with Patty. When he tried again, Patty hoped “to do right” but feared that she should “fail through sorrow.” After he died,...
